question: On page 41, column 1 contains two distinct semantic sections: 'Data Methodology' and 'FY24 Results'. Identify the full sentence that serves as the boundary line where the text switches from methodology to results.

question: On page 13, extract the introductory paragraph immediately following the 'Carbon Table 2' title. Ensure the extraction is free of any page headers, navigation tabs, or document titles located at the top of the page.

model_answer.answer: Microsoft’s Scope 3 emissions continue to account for more than 97% of our total emissions. Tackling Scope 3 means decarbonizing industrial processes such as steel, concrete, and other building material production for use in our campus and datacenter construction, as well as jet fuel for business travel and logistics, with the vast majority of these emissions coming from two categories upstream, Purchased Goods and Services (Category 1) and Capital Goods (Category 2), and one downstream, Use of Sold Products (Category 11).
model_answer.rationale: On printed page 13, under the heading 'Our approach continued' and the title 'Carbon Table 2', the next block of body text is a single paragraph beginning 'Microsoft’s Scope 3 emissions continue to account for more than 97% of our total emissions.' This paragraph immediately follows the 'Carbon Table 2' title and precedes the bullet list of Scope 3 categories.

scores.correctness_justification: The model correctly extracted the exact paragraph without any noise.
scores.judge_reasoning: The model correctly extracted the exact paragraph without any noise.

question: On page 49, extract the main body text under the 'Protecting ecosystems' heading. Do not include the '>30%' statistic or the 'Land protection' sidebar text located to the left of the main column.

model_answer.answer:
Healthy ecosystems are essential for life on Earth. They provide clean air, water, food, and countless other benefits that sustain communities, economies, and ecosystems globally. Yet these ecosystems face mounting threats from climate change and biodiversity loss, and require urgent and coordinated action.

Our approach
Microsoft recognizes the interconnectedness of ecosystem health with all aspects of sustainability. From supporting pollinator habitats at our campuses to integrating biodiversity into datacenter designs, we are embedding ecological considerations into our operations. Through partnerships with conservation organizations and the application of innovative technologies, we are helping to monitor, protect, and restore ecosystems, driving meaningful environmental impact at both local and global scales.

Total land protected
15,849 acres

Microsoft land use footprint
11,900 acres

Total land contracted to be protected
17,439 acres

Meeting our target of protecting more land than we use by 2025
As of FY24, Microsoft has contracted to protect 17,439 acres of land, and 15,849 acres were designated as permanently protected.

Find out more in our Data Fact Sheet
model_answer.rationale: On printed page 49 under the 'Protecting ecosystems' heading, the main central column contains the introductory paragraphs about ecosystem importance and Microsoft's approach, followed by text blocks describing total land protected, land use footprint, total land contracted, and a short paragraph on meeting the protection target and referencing the Data Fact Sheet. I excluded the 'Land protection' sidebar (with the >30% statistic) to the side of the main column, as well as any text containing the '>30%' statistic, in line with the instructions.

scores.correctness_justification: Core content is correct but included excluded sidebar text.
scores.judge_reasoning: Core content is correct but included excluded sidebar text.

question: On page 29, extract a description of the growth trend shown in the 'Total contracted volume' chart. Specifically, describe the visual difference in growth magnitude between FY22 and FY24.

model_answer.answer: The chart shows that between FY22 and FY24 the total contracted water replenishment volume grows dramatically, rising from about 13.2 million m³ in FY22 to about 50.0 million m³ in FY24. Visually, the FY24 bar is several times taller—nearly quadruple the FY22 bar and roughly twice the FY23 bar—indicating a much larger growth magnitude over this period than in earlier years.

question: Refer to the 'Packaging recyclability' chart on page 45. Identify the specific fiscal year where the visual trend reverses and the value drops compared to the year before.
